item.title: Understanding Seven Deadly Sins
item.description: The way we behave is mostly influenced by our surroundings (by law of averages you shall become average of folks you spend time with, over a long period of time) until and unless we mindfully start tweaking these behaviours. Here, as the title suggests, I write about these conventional vices with the aim to define/understand them better, most of which are the basis of our sufferings. The seven deadly sins, also known as the capital vices or cardinal sins, is a grouping and classification of vices within Christian teachings.

item.description: Alone Living alone teaches you the importance of someone’s company Anger memory of pain in the past messenger that shows you that something important to you is being betrayed, squashed, or overlooked. A boundary, a value, a desire. Don’t kill (supress) that messenger (ofcourse don’t react). best remedy is to delay (any reaction) understand the source, when you get irritated, write and explain the feelings, it might help in identifying the source “The opposite of anger is not calmness, its empathy” – Mehmet Oz Anxiety worry about something that has typically yet to happen (future) guilt causes anxiety (eg: lying, procrastination) body’s natural response to stress Anxiety is not having clarity about what is within one’s control and what is outside of one’s control - partially correct?
